.
When to Apply the Provisions of 38 CFR 3.105(e)
Apply the provisions of
38 CFR 3.105(e)
only
if a lower evaluation of an SC disability would result in a reduction or discontinuance of compensation payments in a running award.
Note
:
When payments have previously been suspended but the evidence shows a reduction in compensation is warranted,
38 CFR 3.105(e)
is not for application.  If payments have been suspended, make a reduction or discontinuance in accordance with the facts found under the authority of
38 CFR 3.500(a)
,
as long as
the date of reduction or discontinuance does not precede the date of last payment.
References
:  For more information on
failure to report for Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) examination with a running award, see
38 CFR 3.655(c)
reductions in disability evaluations under
38 CFR 3.105(e)
, see
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 4.B
, and
VAOPCGCPREC 71-1991
, and
proposed rating decisions, see
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 3.D
.
